member.name: T:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions
member.summary: The options used to construct AWS service clients like the Amazon.S3.AmazonS3Client.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions.Profile
member.summary: The profile used to fetch AWS credentials for from the profile manager.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions.ProfilesLocation
member.summary: The location of the registered profiles. Set if using the non standard locations for profile stores. This is mostly used when running the application outside of an EC2 instance where the preferred IAM credentials are used and also not running under a logged on user.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions.Region
member.summary: The AWS region the service client should use when making service operations.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions.SessionRoleArn
member.summary: If set this role will be assumed using the resolved AWS credentials.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions.SessionName
member.summary: The session name for the assumed session using the SessionRoleArn.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions.ExternalId
member.summary: A unique identifier that is used by third parties for the assumed session using the SessionRoleArn.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions.Credentials
member.summary: AWS Credentials used for creating service clients. If this is set it overrides the Profile property.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions.DefaultConfigurationMode
member.summary: The default configuration mode set for created service clients.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions.DefaultClientConfig
member.summary: A default ClientConfig object. When service client is created any values set on the default ClientConfig are copied to the service specific client config.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions.Logging
member.summary: Logging settings that should be applied to SDK global configuration. This setting is applied while creating the service client through this package.

member.name: M:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions.CreateServiceClient``1
member.summary: Create a service client for the specified service interface using the options set in this instance. For example if T is set to IAmazonS3 then the AmazonS3ServiceClient which implements IAmazonS3 is created and returned.
member.typeparam: The service interface that a service client will be created for.
member.returns: The service client that implements the service interface.

member.name: T:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions.LoggingSetting
member.summary: Container for logging settings of the SDK

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions.LoggingSetting.LogTo
member.summary: Logging destination.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions.LoggingSetting.LogResponses
member.summary: When to log responses.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions.LoggingSetting.LogResponsesSizeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the size limit in bytes for logged responses. If logging for response body is enabled, logged response body is limited to this size. The SDK defaults to 1KB if this property is net set.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions.LoggingSetting.LogMetrics
member.summary: Whether or not to log SDK metrics.

member.name: T:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.ClientFactory`1
member.summary: The factory class for creating AWS service clients from the AWS SDK for .NET.

member.name: M:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.ClientFactory`1.#ctor(Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions)
member.summary: Constructs an instance of the ClientFactory
member.param: The AWS options used for creating service clients.

member.name: M:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.ClientFactory`1.CreateServiceClient(System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Creates the AWS service client that implements the service client interface. The AWSOptions object will be searched for in the IServiceProvider.
member.param: The dependency injection provider.

member.name: M:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.ClientFactory`1.CreateServiceClient(Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger,Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions)
member.summary: Creates the AWS service client that implements the service client interface. The AWSOptions object will be searched for in the IServiceProvider.
member.param: Logger instance for writing diagnostic logs.
The AWS options used for creating the service client.

member.name: M:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.ClientFactory`1.PerformGlobalConfig(Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger,Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions)
member.summary: Performs all of the global settings that have been specified in AWSOptions.

member.name: M:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.ClientFactory`1.CreateClient(Amazon.Runtime.AWSCredentials,Amazon.Runtime.ClientConfig)
member.summary: Creates the service client using the credentials and client config.

member.name: M:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.ClientFactory`1.CreateCredentials(Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger,Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions)
member.summary: Creates the AWSCredentials using either the profile indicated from the AWSOptions object of the SDK fallback credentials search.

member.name: M:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.ClientFactory`1.CreateConfig(Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions)
member.summary: Creates the ClientConfig object for the service client.

member.name: T:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.ConfigurationException
member.summary: Exception for errors loading AWS options from IConfiguration object.

member.name: M:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.ConfigurationException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Construct instance of ConfigurationException
member.param: The error message.

member.name: M:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.ConfigurationException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Construct instance of ConfigurationException
member.param: The error message.
Original exception.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.ConfigurationException.PropertyName
member.summary: The property that has an invalid value.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.ConfigurationException.PropertyValue
member.summary: The value that was configured for the PropertyName.

member.name: T:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig
member.summary: Settings that will be applied to service client config objects when service clients are created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.AllowAutoRedirect
member.summary: This flag controls if .NET HTTP infrastructure should follow redirection responses (e.g. HTTP 307 - temporary redirect).

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.AuthenticationRegion
member.summary: Gets and sets the AuthenticationRegion property. Used in AWS4 request signing, this is an optional property; change it only if the region cannot be determined from the service endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.AuthSchemePreference
member.summary: List of preferred authentication schemes in priority order. When a service supports multiple authentication schemes, the SDK attempts to use schemes from this list in the specified order, falling back to default behavior if none of the preferred schemes are available.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.BufferSize
member.summary: Gets and Sets the BufferSize property. The BufferSize controls the buffer used to read in from input streams and write out to the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.ClientAppId

summary.para: ClientAppId is an optional application specific identifier that can be set. When set it will be appended to the User-Agent header of every request in the form of app/{ClientAppId}.

If the ClientAppId is not set on the object the SDK will search the environment variable AWS_SDK_UA_APP_ID and the shared config profile attribute sdk_ua_app_id for a potential value for the ClientAppId.

member.remarks: See for more information on environment variables and shared config settings.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.DisableHostPrefixInjection
member.summary: Gets and sets the DisableHostPrefixInjection flag. If true, host prefix injection will be disabled for this client, the default value of this flag is false. Host prefix injection prefixes the service endpoint with request members from APIs which use this feature. Example: for a hostPrefix of "foo-name." and a endpoint of "service.region.amazonaws.com" the default behavior is to prefix the endpoint with the hostPrefix resulting in a final endpoint of "foo-name.service.region.amazonaws.com". Setting DisableHostPrefixInjection to true will disable hostPrefix injection resulting in a final endpoint of "service.region.amazonaws.com" regardless of the value of hostPrefix. E.g. You may want to disable host prefix injection for testing against a local mock endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.DisableLogging
member.summary: Gets and sets the DisableLogging. If true logging for this client will be disabled.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.DisableRequestCompression
member.summary: Controls whether request payloads are automatically compressed for supported operations. This setting only applies to operations that support compression. The default value is "false". Set to "true" to disable compression.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.EndpointDiscoveryCacheLimit
member.summary: Returns the maximum number of discovered endpoints that can be stored within the cache for the client. The default limit is 1000 cache entries.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.EndpointDiscoveryEnabled
member.summary: Returns the flag indicating if endpoint discovery should be enabled or disabled for operations that are not required to use endpoint discovery.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.FastFailRequests
member.summary: Under Adaptive retry mode, this flag determines if the client should wait for a send token to become available or don't block and fail the request immediately if a send token is not available.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.HttpClientCacheSize
member.summary:
If CacheHttpClient is set to true then HttpClientCacheSize controls the number of HttpClients cached.
The default value is 1 which is suitable for Windows and for all other platforms that have HttpClient implementations using System.Net.Http.SocketsHttpHandler (.NET Core 2.1 and higher).

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.IgnoreConfiguredEndpointUrls
member.summary: If set to true the SDK will ignore the configured endpointUrls in the config file or in the environment variables. By default it is set to false.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.LogMetrics
member.summary: Flag on whether to log metrics for service calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.LogResponse
member.summary: Gets and sets the LogResponse property. If this property is set to true, the service response is logged. The size of response being logged is controlled by the AWSConfigs.LoggingConfig.LogResponsesSizeLimit property.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.MaxErrorRetry
member.summary: Returns the flag indicating how many retry HTTP requests an SDK should make for a single SDK operation invocation before giving up. For RetryMode values of "Standard" or "Adaptive" this flag will return 2. In addition to the values returned that are dependent on the RetryMode, the value can be set to a specific value by using the AWS_MAX_ATTEMPTS environment variable, max_attempts in the shared configuration file, or by setting a value directly on this property. When using AWS_MAX_ATTEMPTS or max_attempts the value returned from this property will be one less than the value entered because this flag is the number of retry requests, not total requests. To learn more about the RetryMode property that affects the values returned by this flag, see .

summary.para: Gets or sets the interval at which progress update events are raised for upload operations. By default, the progress update events are raised at every 100KB of data transferred.
If the value of this property is set less than ClientConfig.BufferSize, progress updates events will be raised at the interval specified by ClientConfig.BufferSize.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.RequestMinCompressionSizeBytes
member.summary: Minimum size in bytes that a request body should be to trigger compression.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.ResignRetries
member.summary: Flag on whether to resign requests on retry or not. For Amazon S3 and Amazon Glacier this value will always be set to true.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.RetryMode
member.summary: Returns the flag indicating the current mode in use for request retries and influences the value returned from . The default value is . This flag can be configured by using the AWS_RETRY_MODE environment variable, retry_mode in the shared configuration file, or by setting this value directly.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.SigV4aSigningRegionSet
member.summary: List of AWS regions for SigV4a multi-region signing. This is used as the default region set for the request if SigV4a is the selected authentication scheme.

summary.para: Gets and sets of the ServiceURL property. This is an optional property; change it only if you want to try a different service endpoint.
RegionEndpoint and ServiceURL are mutually exclusive properties. Whichever property is set last will cause the other to automatically be reset to null.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.ThrottleRetries
member.summary: Enable or disable the Retry Throttling feature by setting the ThrottleRetries flag to True/False respectively. Retry Throttling is a feature that intelligently throttles retry attempts when a large percentage of requests are failing and retries are unsuccessful as well. In such situations the allotted retry capacity for the service URL will be drained until requests start to succeed again. Once the requisite capacity is available, retries would be permitted again. When retries are throttled, the service enters a fail-fast behaviour as the traditional retry attempt for the request would be circumvented. Hence, errors will resurface quickly. This will result in a greater number of exceptions but prevents requests being tied up in unsuccessful retry attempts. Note: Retry Throttling is enabled by default. Set the ThrottleRetries flag to false to switch off this feature.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.Timeout
member.summary: The timeout that is set on the HttpClient Timeout for configuring the wait time for requests time out.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.ConnectTimeout
member.summary: Gets and sets the connection timeout that will be set on the HttpClient used by the service client to make requests. The connection timeout is used control the wait time for the connection to be established to the service. The default connection timeout for the HttpClient infinite waiting period.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.MaxConnectionsPerServer
member.summary: This property is used to set the MaxConnectionsPerServer on the matching property on the underlying HttpClient to make service calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.UseAlternateUserAgentHeader
member.summary:
When set to true, the service client will use the x-amz-user-agent header instead of the User-Agent header to report version and environment information to the AWS service.
Note: This is especially useful when using a platform like WebAssembly which doesn't allow to specify the User-Agent header.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.UseDualstackEndpoint
member.summary: Configures the endpoint calculation for a service to go to a dual stack (ipv6 enabled) endpoint for the configured region.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.UseFIPSEndpoint
member.summary: Configures the endpoint calculation to go to a FIPS (https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/fips/) endpoint for the configured region.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.UseHttp
member.summary: Gets and sets the UseHttp. If this property is set to true, the client attempts to use HTTP protocol, if the target endpoint supports it. By default, this property is set to false.
member.remarks: This does not apply if an explicit is specified.

member.name: P:Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.DefaultClientConfig.ServiceSpecificSettings
member.summary:
Service specific config settings. For example Amazon S3's config property UseAccelerateEndpoint property.
Setting these config on the service specific setting requires .NET reflection. If running in a trimmed environment like Native AOT additional testing is required to ensure the reflection does not attempt to access code that has been trimmed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.ConfigurationExtensions
member.summary: This class adds extension methods to IConfiguration making it easier to pull out AWS configuration options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.ConfigurationExtensions.DEFAULT_CONFIG_SECTION
member.summary: The default section where settings are read from the IConfiguration object. This is set to "AWS".

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.ConfigurationExtensions.GetAWSOptions(Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration)
member.summary: Constructs an AWSOptions class with the options specified in the "AWS" section in the IConfiguration object.
member.returns: The AWSOptions containing the values set in configuration system.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.ConfigurationExtensions.GetAWSOptions(Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs an AWSOptions class with the options specified in the "AWS" section in the IConfiguration object.
member.param: The config section to extract AWS options from.
member.returns: The AWSOptions containing the values set in configuration system.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceCollectionExtensions
member.summary: This class adds extension methods to IServiceCollection making it easier to add Amazon service clients to the NET Core dependency injection framework.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceCollectionExtensions.AddDefaultAWSOptions(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions)
member.summary: Adds the AWSOptions object to the dependency injection framework providing information that will be used to construct Amazon service clients.
member.param: The default AWS options used to construct AWS service clients with.
member.returns: Returns back the IServiceCollection to continue the fluent system of IServiceCollection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceCollectionExtensions.AddDefaultAWSOptions(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.Func{System.IServiceProvider,Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions},Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceLifetime)
member.summary: Adds the AWSOptions object to the dependency injection framework providing information that will be used to construct Amazon service clients.
member.param: The factory that creates the default AWS options. The AWS options will be used to construct AWS service clients
The lifetime of the AWSOptions. The default is Singleton.
member.returns: Returns back the IServiceCollection to continue the fluent system of IServiceCollection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceCollectionExtensions.TryAddDefaultAWSOptions(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions)
member.summary: Adds the AWSOptions object to the dependency injection framework providing information that will be used to construct Amazon service clients if they haven't already been registered.
member.param: The default AWS options used to construct AWS service clients with.
member.returns: Returns back the IServiceCollection to continue the fluent system of IServiceCollection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceCollectionExtensions.TryAddDefaultAWSOptions(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.Func{System.IServiceProvider,Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions},Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceLifetime)
member.summary: Adds the AWSOptions object to the dependency injection framework providing information that will be used to construct Amazon service clients if they haven't already been registered.
member.param: The factory that creates the default AWS options. The AWS options will be used to construct AWS service clients
The lifetime of the AWSOptions. The default is Singleton.
member.returns: Returns back the IServiceCollection to continue the fluent system of IServiceCollection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceCollectionExtensions.AddAWSService``1(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceLifetime)
member.summary: Adds the Amazon service client to the dependency injection framework. The Amazon service client is not created until it is requested. If the ServiceLifetime property is set to Singleton, the default, then the same instance will be reused for the lifetime of the process and the object should not be disposed.
member.typeparam: The AWS service interface, like IAmazonS3.
member.param: The lifetime of the service client created. The default is Singleton.
member.returns: Returns back the IServiceCollection to continue the fluent system of IServiceCollection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceCollectionExtensions.AddAWSService``1(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions,Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceLifetime)
member.summary: Adds the Amazon service client to the dependency injection framework. The Amazon service client is not created until it is requested. If the ServiceLifetime property is set to Singleton, the default, then the same instance will be reused for the lifetime of the process and the object should not be disposed.
member.typeparam: The AWS service interface, like IAmazonS3.
member.param: The AWS options used to create the service client overriding the default AWS options added using AddDefaultAWSOptions.
The lifetime of the service client created. The default is Singleton.
member.returns: Returns back the IServiceCollection to continue the fluent system of IServiceCollection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceCollectionExtensions.TryAddAWSService``1(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceLifetime)
member.summary: Adds the Amazon service client to the dependency injection framework if the service type hasn't already been registered. The Amazon service client is not created until it is requested. If the ServiceLifetime property is set to Singleton, the default, then the same instance will be reused for the lifetime of the process and the object should not be disposed.
member.typeparam: The AWS service interface, like IAmazonS3.
member.param: The lifetime of the service client created. The default is Singleton.
member.returns: Returns back the IServiceCollection to continue the fluent system of IServiceCollection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceCollectionExtensions.TryAddAWSService``1(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions,Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceLifetime)
member.summary: Adds the Amazon service client to the dependency injection framework if the service type hasn't already been registered. The Amazon service client is not created until it is requested. If the ServiceLifetime property is set to Singleton, the default, then the same instance will be reused for the lifetime of the process and the object should not be disposed.
member.typeparam: The AWS service interface, like IAmazonS3.
member.param: The AWS options used to create the service client overriding the default AWS options added using AddDefaultAWSOptions.
The lifetime of the service client created. The default is Singleton.
member.returns: Returns back the IServiceCollection to continue the fluent system of IServiceCollection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceCollectionExtensions.AddKeyedAWSService``1(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.Object,Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceLifetime)
member.summary: Adds the Amazon service client to the dependency injection framework with a key. The Amazon service client is not created until it is requested. If the ServiceLifetime property is set to Singleton, the default, then the same instance will be reused for the lifetime of the process and the object should not be disposed.
member.typeparam: The AWS service interface, like IAmazonS3
member.param: The key with which the service will be added in the dependency injection framework.
The lifetime of the service client created. The default is Singleton.
member.returns: Returns back the IServiceCollection to continue the fluent system of IServiceCollection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceCollectionExtensions.AddKeyedAWSService``1(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.Object,Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions,Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceLifetime)
member.summary: Adds the Amazon service client to the dependency injection framework with a key. The Amazon service client is not created until it is requested. If the ServiceLifetime property is set to Singleton, the default, then the same instance will be reused for the lifetime of the process and the object should not be disposed.
member.typeparam: The AWS service interface, like IAmazonS3
member.param: The key with which the service will be added in the dependency injection framework.
The AWS options used to create the service client overriding the default AWS options added using AddDefaultAWSOptions.
The lifetime of the service client created. The default is Singleton.
member.returns: Returns back the IServiceCollection to continue the fluent system of IServiceCollection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceCollectionExtensions.TryAddKeyedAWSService``1(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.Object,Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceLifetime)
member.summary: Adds the Amazon service client to the dependency injection framework with a key if the service type hasn't already been registered with the same key. The Amazon service client is not created until it is requested. If the ServiceLifetime property is set to Singleton, the default, then the same instance will be reused for the lifetime of the process and the object should not be disposed.
member.typeparam: The AWS service interface, like IAmazonS3
member.param: The key with which the service will be added in the dependency injection framework.
The lifetime of the service client created. The default is Singleton.
member.returns: Returns back the IServiceCollection to continue the fluent system of IServiceCollection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceCollectionExtensions.TryAddKeyedAWSService``1(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.Object,Amazon.Extensions.NETCore.Setup.AWSOptions,Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceLifetime)
member.summary: Adds the Amazon service client to the dependency injection framework with a key if the service type hasn't already been registered with the same key. The Amazon service client is not created until it is requested. If the ServiceLifetime property is set to Singleton, the default, then the same instance will be reused for the lifetime of the process and the object should not be disposed.
member.typeparam: The AWS service interface, like IAmazonS3
member.param: The key with which the service will be added in the dependency injection framework.
The AWS options used to create the service client overriding the default AWS options added using AddDefaultAWSOptions.
The lifetime of the service client created. The default is Singleton.
member.returns: Returns back the IServiceCollection to continue the fluent system of IServiceCollection.
